result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant in DCJ.  Drug court assessment paperwork sent to DCJ to have completed and returned to JMH.
Status conference on November 11, 2022 at 11:00 am.

1:53 PM Attorney Robert Arthur August Baranowski in court for Luis M Ortiz.  Prosecuting attorney Robin W Lee in court for the State of Wisconsin.  DE is in custody, being screened for drug court. Set for a STC after 10/24

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Motion and Demand for Discovery and Notice of DNA and Witness List- State of Wisconsin
Status conference on October 12, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Information was E-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defendant waived reading of Information; Defendant stood mute, Court enters plea of Not Guilty; motions due in 20 days; bail continued.

Defendant Luis M Ortiz in court, in custody.  Attorney Robert Arthur August Baranowski in court for Luis M Ortiz.  Attorney Cecelia DeMarco in court for State of Wisconsin. Defn filed a motion to dismiss ct 3. Argument by Atty Baranowski. Argument by ADA DeMarco. Argument by Atty Baranowski. CT makes findings and finds the complaint is sufficient to deny defn's motion to dismiss. State moves for the CT to find felony counts transactionally related; argument by ADA DeMarco. Defn objects; argument by Atty Baranowski. Argument by ADA DeMarco. CT makes findings and denies the State's motion. State to prove PC on both felony cts. MPD Det. Kenneth Mosley, duly sworn and testified. Direct Exam by ADA DeMarco. Venue established. Witness identification. Witness excused at 9:46 am. State moves for bind over, argument by ADA DeMarco. Defn objected to bind over. Argument by Atty Baranowski. Argument by ADA DeMarco. CT makes findings and found PC on ct 1 this defn committed a felony and bound over to branch 13. CT makes findings and does not find PC on ct 3 and orders ct 3 dismissed.
Motion to Dismiss Count 3 of the Complaint- Defendant

State has requested this be set over, Defense does not object.  Time limits have not been waived.  Defendant waives time limits.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Jedidiah F or Kevin H.
- Defendant shall not be at Madtown Fitness.
Parties did not stipulate to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Trial Judge - Br 13

2:43 PM Prosecuting attorney Rebekah M Rennicke in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Luis M Ortiz in court, in custody.  Attorney Tracey J Lencioni in court for Luis M Ortiz. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on August 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.
